title: Actually download metadata in parallel

commits.message:
Actually download metadata in parallel

When using the gradle/gradle build as an example, we were never downloading metadata in parallel during graph resolution.
This is due to a number of things

1. Our UNCONSTRAINED executer was not actually unconstrained. Its worker threads still required a worker lease, and therefore
any work scheduled on an unconstrained executor would still have its concurrency limited to the number of cores on the machine.
We fix this by not requiring unconstrained workers to acquire worker leases.
2. When using filtered repositories, we aways returned MetadataFetchingCost.FAST if a dependency did not match our filter.
If one repository claims a fast fetching cost, then we short circuit and assume we do not need to download in parallel.
Presumably, we had one of the first repos in our build have a filter that did not match many dependencies, so for all metadata
fetching we would not download in parallel.

So, this commit properly unconstrains the UNCONSTRAINED executer, and fixes filtered repositories so they download metadata in parallel.

One thing to note is that we moved artifact resolution to the MAX_WORKERS executor instead of the UNCONSTRAINED executor, since we perform
transforms while doing artifact resolution. This means if UNCONSTRAINED actually worked the way it should have worked, we would have
been performing way more transforms in parallel than we intended.

In practice, since the unconstrained pool was already limited to the number of CPUs, this should make no difference. However, this
shows that we are not downloading artifacts with high parallelism. We should somehow update parallel artifact resolution to schedule
transforms on the MAX_WORKERS executor and file downloads on the UNCONSTRAINED executor.

title: Deprecate ResolvedDependency parent artifact methods

commits.message:
Deprecate ResolvedDependency parent artifact methods

ResolvedDependency exposes method that allow dependencies from a certain parent node to be individually
requested. Some edges from a given parent may have different dependencies if it has different attributes,
excludes, target configurations, or capabilities.

ArtifactView operates on a node-by-node basis and does not operate on edges. We are planning to implement
improvements to ArtifactView that will replace ResolvedConfiguration, LenientConfiguration, and ResolvedDependency,
but that improvement will remain node-aware and not edge aware.

This commit prepares us for this by deprecating APIs that require data that will not be tracked in future versions
of Gradle.

title: Project root components are identified by root component identifier

commits.message:
Identify project root components with RootComponentIdentifier

Place all project components in a synthetic root component, instead of being placed in the
project's official component.

This allows projects to resolve different versions of their own component, instead of being forced
to resolve the local version of their component.

TODO: Update the 'root' method in ResolveTestFixture

The root component no longer has identity. All places where we call this root method, we should
update it to pass in no parameters

title: verify M2 and Ivy patterns contain the required tokens in any pattern

commits.message:
verify M2 and Ivy patterns contain the required tokens in any pattern

Permit more flexible repository layout patterns.

Instead of strictly checking for an exact repository pattern, instead verify the patterns contain the required tokens.

- M2 patterns must contain: `organisation`, `module`, `artifact`.
- Ivy patterns must contain: `artifact`.

The existing checks already required these tokens. They are still required, but the position is not fixed.

Signed-off-by: Adam <897017+aSemy@users.noreply.github.com>

title: Expose public API for async exec in ExecOperations

commits.message:
Expose public API for async exec in ExecOperations

Support async execution of external processes using ExecOperations.

`ExecOperations#execAsync` returns a `ExecHandle` that can be used to abort, or await the result of, the process.

Fix #32502

title: Prepare compiler workers for splitting into separate projects

commits.message:
Use immutable classes for compiler worker specs

Use only fully immutable classes for the specs we send to the java, scala, and groovy compiler workers.
Also ensure they are constructed in a way that they do not have compile-time dependenices on the mutable
DSL types that they are generated from.
